<<<<<<< HEAD
An elegy on the much lamented Sir William Waller, who valiantly hang'd himself at Rotterdam.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed by N.T. at the entrance into the Old-Spring-Garden, [London] : 1683.
Verse: "Rise, grim Alecto, rise ('tis fit to chuse ..." A satirical attack on Waller. Place of publication suggested by Wing. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======

the entrance into the Old-Spring-Garden
